The OSCE Special Monitoring Mission to Ukraine continued to monitor the security situation throughout the country. It observed that while the number of ceasefire violations increased between 19 and 25 December 2016, this was followed by a decrease in the subsequent two weeks.

Between 19 December 2016 and 8 January 2017 approximately half of all ceasefire violations occurred in areas south-east and east of Svitlodarsk. The remaining ceasefire violations largely took place in four other hotspots: areas east and north-east of Mariupol; the western and northern outskirts of Horlivka; the Avdiivka-Yasynuvata-Donetsk airport triangle; and areas of western Luhansk region.

The SMM continued to observe weapons missing from storage sites as well as the presence and use of proscribed weapons in violation of withdrawal lines.
